intro: Lespedeza potaninii var. breviracemi, commonly known as the short-lobed lespeDEZA, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sunlight. Its botanical features include hairy stems and pods that contain lens-shaped seeds, making it a notable species in ecological studies.
